intro: Agrestis polymorpha, commonly known as the variable grass. It is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae, characterized by its adaptability to various environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its morphology varies depending on local climate and soil conditions, which contributes to its common name. Agrestis polymorpha is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
